{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3130133,"name":"","username":"hello.world","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hello.world/{size}/182568_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T23:47:50.312Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone! What gearboxes would you recommend using with NEO brushless motors?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T23:47:50.312Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1662,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":8359.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56246,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"mechanical creature"},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/1","custom_user_title":"mechanical creature","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3130134,"name":"Saber_8871","username":"tyron256","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyron256/{size}/177261_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T23:52:37.784Z","cooked":"

Depends on the application really. is this for drive? mechanisms?

in more general terms, anything that can accommodate CIMs can in theory house a NEO in its place (hole pattern is the same, might need special attention to motor pinion gear) but once again, depends what you’re trying to do.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T23:52:37.784Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":101,"reads":265,"readers_count":264,"score":563.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"Saber_8871","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7167,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130141,"name":"","username":"hello.world","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hello.world/{size}/182568_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-19T23:55:53.894Z","cooked":"

Thanks! It’s for the base of a pulley-like mechanism using a belt.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-19T23:55:53.894Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":145,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":780.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":7167,"username":"tyron256","name":"Saber_8871","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyron256/{size}/177261_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56246,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"mechanical creature"},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/3","custom_user_title":"mechanical creature","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130155,"name":"Saber_8871","username":"tyron256","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyron256/{size}/177261_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T00:03:30.909Z","cooked":"

here are a couple of options that should fit. the first is from REV and the other is from Andymark. Both are planetary gearboxes that should be compatible with NEOs. the thing you need to figure out is the type of gear ratio you want to use for your application.

https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-21-2100/

https://www.andymark.com/products/cim-sport-options?via=Z2lkOi8vYW5keW1hcmsvV29ya2FyZWE6OkNhdGFsb2c6OkNhdGVnb3J5LzViMzY1MGNlYmM2ZjZkM2UyNzczOGY5MQ

Naturally there are probably other options out there but i encourage you to take a look around for yourself. There are others out there that sell gearboxes, just make sure you arent buying one meant more for drive trains unless you want that kind of speed for some reason.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T00:03:30.909Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":241,"readers_count":240,"score":298.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"Saber_8871","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-21-2100/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MAXPlanetary System Kit - REV Robotics","clicks":270},{"url":"https://www.andymark.com/products/cim-sport-options?via=Z2lkOi8vYW5keW1hcmsvV29ya2FyZWE6OkNhdGFsb2c6OkNhdGVnb3J5LzViMzY1MGNlYmM2ZjZkM2UyNzczOGY5MQ","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":223}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":56246,"username":"hello.world","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hello.world/{size}/182568_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7167,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130178,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T00:32:29.482Z","cooked":"

REV MAXPlanetary was easy to use and bombproof last year. We plan to use them again.

The blue Sport gearboxes from AndyMark are also bombproof and usually a bit cheaper, but at the expense of no swapping ratios and needing to press the pinion on the motor (mercifully easier with the updated NEO 1.1).

If you play with the NEO 550, the UltraPlanetary is great for high-speed mechanisms (up to about 20-30:1 ratio, check the guide). Cheap, light, compact, what’s not to love?

All three are completely honest options in 2023 for a mechanism gearbox.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T00:32:29.482Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":165.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/5","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130193,"name":"Saber_8871","username":"tyron256","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyron256/{size}/177261_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T00:47:43.640Z","cooked":"

honestly, good to hear that the REV MAXPlanetaries are reliable. We are swapping to those from Vex this year and while they look like they can do the job ive never worked with them before. I like the interchangable ratios, should allow us to fine tune our mechanisms without having to resort to adding more complexity if something doesnt work out immediately.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T00:47:43.640Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":64.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"Saber_8871","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7167,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130289,"name":"","username":"Thor5090","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thor5090/{size}/226064_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T02:40:52.499Z","cooked":"

Max planetary system is a dream to work with and bulletproof. No grease all over and trying to figure out what sun gear goes to which set or trying to get the kids to put the correct ratio label on the outside of the case. We fully swapped over this year after testing a couple last year. Adjusting ratios on the robot is easy if you need to. You can also get different length hex shaft for the output if needed. Couldn’t really ask for more. Ultra planetary is a very similar design but uses metric screws for assembly and is lighter duty.

Edit: only draw back to the Max is they are a little on the heavy side

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-01-20T02:43:25.910Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":98.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423963,"topic_slug":"gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7167,"username":"tyron256","name":"Saber_8871","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyron256/{size}/177261_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53198,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"My views are mine and mine alone"},"post_url":"/t/gearboxes-for-neo-brushless-motors/423963/7","custom_user_title":"My views are mine and mine alone","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3130293,"name":"Aidan Mundy","username":"Aidan-Mundy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aidan-mundy/{size}/177044_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-20T02:52:38.448Z","cooked":"
Billfred:

REV MAXPlanetary was easy to use and bombproof last year. We plan to use them again.

I know others have also espoused how great these are, but:

We used them to climb last year. This year, every mechanism on our robot will be powered by a MAXPlanetary (except the kit chassis). They work great, there’s no need to mess with grease, no a low risk of a student disassembling the stages thinking the parts are interchangeable, no need to permanently alter motors by cutting the shafts in half, and the torque ratings are though the roof, among many other great things.
